intro: Eugenia bolampattiana, commonly known as the Bolampatti eugenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
